back_cards.example_en: The wind blew the leaves across the yard.

back_cards.definition_en: To produce a sound by air
back_cards.example_en: He blew the trumpet loudly.
She blew her chance at the promotion.
The tire blew on the highway.
Blow out the candles on your cake.
The object on the table is a book.
Her object was to finish the race.
The cat is the object of affection.
The coder created a new object.
The statue was the object of admiration.
She expressed her joy at the news.
He expressed his ideas in the meeting.
They expressed the package overnight.
Her smile expressed her gratitude.
The poet expressed love beautifully.
Huh, where did my keys go?
You’re leaving now? Huh?
Huh, you finished already?
It’s late, huh?
Nice weather, huh?
She encouraged her friend to try again.
The coach encouraged teamwork.
He encouraged her to join the club.
They encouraged recycling in the office.
Her words encouraged the students.
The matter was discussed in the meeting.
Organic matter enriched the soil.
It’s a matter of life and death.
What’s the matter with your car?
The book’s matter was fascinating.
She writes a blog about travel.
His blog discusses tech trends.
I read a blog about cooking tips.
Her blog shares daily life stories.
The company’s blog attracts customers.
Her smile brightened the room.
He gave a smile to the stranger.
A smile crossed her face at the joke.
The teacher’s smile encouraged him.
Her smile welcomed the guests.
She returned home after work.
He returned the borrowed book.
I’ll return your call later.
The investment returned a good profit.
The weather returned to normal.
Her belief in justice drove her.
His belief shapes his daily life.
It’s my belief that honesty matters.
Their belief in the team paid off.
Freedom is a core belief of hers.
The block of wood was carved.
The store is two blocks away.
Fear was a block to her success.
They bought a block of tickets.
She has a block of free time.
He paid off his student debt.
The company has a large debt.
She’s in debt after her trip.
I owe a debt of gratitude.
The debt weighed on his mind.
The fire warmed the campsite.
The fire destroyed the house.
Her speech was full of fire.
The soldiers opened fire.
We sat by the fire all night.
Manual labor built the bridge.
She went into labor last night.
Labor unions fought for rights.
His labor improved the garden.
The project was a labor of love.
Her understanding of math improved.
He showed understanding for her loss.
They reached an understanding.
His understanding of history is deep.
We have an understanding about work.
Our neighborhood is quiet and safe.
The neighborhood helped clean the park.
There’s a café in the neighborhood.
This neighborhood has old houses.
Kids play in the neighborhood streets.
They signed a contract for the job.
The contract outlined the terms.
She got a contract with a publisher.
The contract was worth millions.
He honored the contract faithfully.
The table stood in the middle.
She’s in the middle of her book.
They met in the middle on price.

back_cards.definition_en: The central part of a story
back_cards.example_en: The middle of the movie was slow.
He found a middle in the debate.
The species of fish is endangered.
Scientists discovered a new species.
This species of plant grows fast.
The forest hosts many species.
A rare species lives in the lake.
We need additional chairs for the party.
She provided additional details.
He worked additional hours this week.
The project needs additional funding.
They offered additional discounts.
